product.title: DragonByte Tech: SEO (Pro)
product.description: DragonByte SEO is an advanced Search Engine Optimisation tool to help increase your forum visibility on search engines.

phrasetype.name: Scheduled Tasks
phrasetype.phrase: Generates each part of the XML sitemap one of the time. This task only actually runs if the option to generate the sitemap is enabled.
(Pro) DragonByte Tech: SEO - Prune Log Entries
Generates each part of the XML sitemap one of the time. This task only actually runs if the option to generate the sitemap is enabled.
DragonByte Tech: SEO - Generate XML Sitemap
Gathers statistics regarding your sitemap and site's SEO performance.

phrasetype.name: DragonByte Tech: SEO
phrasetype.phrase:
Are you sure you want to delete the Keyword called '{1}'?
({2}: {3})

{4} This action can not be undone.

Are you sure you want to delete the Custom Sitemap URL called '{1}'?
({2}: {3})

{4} This action can not be undone.
Are you sure you wish to import? All existing configuration will be overwritten!
Are you sure you would like to prune the Custom Sitemap URLs?
Are you sure you want to remove the existing sitemap session? This is necessary if you want to resolve a failed sitemap build or interrupt the scheduled task that builds the sitemap.
Are you sure you wish to reset your settings to their default values?
Are you sure you wish to reset all your content tags?
Powered by DragonByte Tech: SEO Version {1} Copyright © {2} DragonByte Technologies. All rights reserved.
Custom Sitemap URL Viewer (page {1}/{2}) | There are {3} total log entries.

URL List You can use this form to upload a file containing a list of URLs to import into the sitemap.
One URL per line.
The DragonByte SEO product has been deactivated by an administrator.

Choose Account / Web Property This is a list of all the Google Analytics Accounts and their Web Properties your Google account has access to.

If your site does not appear on this list, you'll need to create a new Google Analytics account at the Google Analytics site.
Profile <dfn>Choose which Google Analytics profile you'd like to view statistics from.</dfn>
Below, you will find information gathered from Google Analytics for your account {1}.
Authentication Code <dfn>Enter the authentication code received from Google here.</dfn>

In order for DragonByte SEO to generate your reports, you must authenticate with your Google account.

No data is transmitted to DragonByte Technologies during the authentication process, it's entirely handled by Google's servers.
Keyword Priority <dfn>This determines the order of preference for inclusion in URL slugs (if Content-Aware Titles are enabled).</dfn>

Mass Add Keywords You can add multiple new keywords quickly via this text area. Place one keyword per line, and optionally followed by the priority.
0 = Low
1 = Medium
2 = High

Example:
test;1
forum;2
word;0
Last Updated <dfn>This controls when the content was last updated, telling search engines it should be re-crawled.</dfn>
You haven't created any keywords yet, why don't you define some?

Sorry, you don't have permission to access the administrative controls on this page.

If you need to access this page, ask your lead administrator to enable your permissions for this page.
Priority Range <dfn>This setting lets you define a priority value between 0.0 and 1.0 to instruct the crawler how important this content is relevant to other pages.</dfn>

You can reset all DragonByte SEO options (excluding the "Global Configuration" found outside this Control Panel) to their default values with this setting.
Note: This cannot be undone!
You can reset all existing content tags using this setting.
You can download a copy of your existing settings here. The XML file can be imported later to instantly restore all your settings.
You can import an XML file containing your DBSEO settings here.
Sitemap Build Log Viewer (page {1}/{2}) | There are {3} total log entries.
Sitemap built successfully. You may view the XML here.
Sitemap Log Viewer (page {1}/{2}) | There are {3} total log entries.
Sitemap URL <dfn>The URL that will be submitted to the sitemap.</dfn>
Spider Log Viewer (page {1}/{2}) | There are {3} total log entries.
Update Frequency <dfn>This indicates to search engines how often this content should be re-crawled.</dfn>
Upload an XML file from your computer

This allows you to manually build the XML sitemap. Once your sitemap has been built, it will automatically be submitted to the search engines you selected in the sitemap options.

The sitemap will be accessed by search engines via this URL.
This will import your existing vBSEO configuration into DragonByte SEO as best as possible.
Welcome to the DragonByte Tech: SEO Admin Control Panel

phrasetype.name: Email Body Text
phrasetype.phrase:
Hello,
Your sitemap for $vboptions[bbtitle] ($vboptions[bburl]) has been generated, and submitted to selected search engines.
Summary: $contenttypes
Regards, $vboptions[bbtitle] System

phrasetype.name: Error Messages
phrasetype.phrase:
The Google Analytics Account ID is missing. Either fill this out manually, or click the "Address" button to get taken to the relevant interface.

It is strongly recommended you enable this feature.

The Google Analytics integration in DragonByte SEO is not enabled. Enabling this feature allows you to obtain advanced statistics about your visitors.

It is strongly recommended you enable this feature.

The Google Analytics Profile ID is missing. Either fill this out manually, or click the "Address" button to get taken to the relevant interface.

It is strongly recommended you enable this feature.

A valid Google Analytics account is required to access this page. You can sign up for Google Analytics here.

Once you have your account ID in the format UA-XXXXXXXX-X, enter it here.

Invalid sitemap content type found. This likely means that the product that provided that type has been removed.

Remove the sitemap session and try again.

Creation of one of the sitemap files failed. Please check the permissions on the sitemap directory.

Once you have done this, remove the sitemap session and try again.
An automatic sitemap build is not scheduled yet. If you wish to build the sitemap, you must change the automatic build frequency in the options or build it manually.

The sitemap generation in DragonByte SEO is not enabled. The sitemap helps search engines find your site, and is automatically submitted to the most popular search engines.

It is strongly recommended you enable this feature.
The sitemap cannot be generated via the scheduled task until the option is enabled.
The sitemap is currently being generated in the admin control panel. The scheduled task will not run while the sitemap is being built in the control panel.
The directory the sitemap files are to be written into is not writeable. Please change the permissions on the path to be writeable by the web server or enter a different path in the sitemap options.
The path {1} is not writeable by the web server. Please log in to your FTP application and CHMOD this directory to 0777.
The sitemap is currently being built via the scheduled task. If you wish to build it manually, remove the sitemap session and try again.
{1}/vbseo/resources/xml/config.xml was not found. Please check that the file exists on your system.
{1}/vbseo/resources/xml/config.xml cannot be read. Please check that the file has CHMOD 644 or higher.
{1}/vbseo/resources/xml/config.xml did not contain the expected content. Please check that the file is the correct vBSEO config file.

You appear to be running with the xcache.admin.enable_auth directive enabled.

In order for DragonByte SEO to function correctly, you must add the following code to your /includes/config.php file:

// ****** XCACHE CONFIGURATION *****
// Here is XCache login information to use XCache instead of MYSql to cache.
$config['xcache']['user'] = '';
$config['xcache']['pass'] = '';


Remember to fill out your username and password, and also remember that the password needs to be in cleartext, not the MD5 hash.

phrasetype.name: GLOBAL
phrasetype.phrase: You can enter a custom Meta Description here. This will override the default description.
You can enter custom Meta Keywords here. This will override the default keywords. Separate each keyword with a comma.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: From time to time, you may want to turn the modification off to the public while you perform maintenance, update versions, etc.
If yes, DBSEO will attempt to add a <link rel="canonical" /> tag to various pages. This helps tell search engines the preferred URL to crawl, reducing the risk & impact of duplicate content.
Enter your Google Analytics account ID, which is usually in a format like so: UA-XXXXXX-X
This setting lets you control whether the Google Analytics code should be automatically added to the forum.
This setting allows you to instruct Google Analytics to anonymise the last octet of the IP address before recording it.

The display features plugin can be used to enable Advertising Features in Google Analytics, such as Remarketing, Demographics and Interest Reporting, and more.
Note: Requires the "Display Advertiser Features" feature turned on in the Property Settings on the Google Analytics website.

This feature allows you to see enhanced statistics regarding link clicks, and also enables statistics for JavaScript generated links.
Note: Requires the "Use enhanced link attribution" feature turned on in the Property Settings on the Google Analytics website.

This is set automatically when you authorise DragonByte SEO to access your Google Analytics account, only erase the value of this setting if you are instructed to do so by DragonByte Technologies support or if you know what you are doing.
This setting lets you choose whether you want to track clicks of external links in Google Analytics.

This setting lets you break down the tracked information further, which can be viewed in separate reports in your Google Analytics account.

Note: This setting will not function with the new "Universal" Google Analytics and will be removed from a future version of this mod.

Google Analytics is being upgraded to a new, superior format dubbed "Universal Analytics". If you have made this change available on your profile, enable this setting once the transfer has been completed.

Note: Do not turn this on if you have not made the transfer yourself, unless you are instructed by a banner notification to make changes to your tracking code! Doing so will mean your Analytics tracking will not function!

This setting allows you to track each individual logged in user across all their devices, even if their IP address changes.
Note: Requires the User ID feature turned on in the Property Settings on the Google Analytics website.
Note: Only works with the "Universal Analytics".
If you need to use a custom prefix for your attachment paths, you can change it here.
If you need to use a custom prefix for your avatar image paths, you can change it here.
If no blog category is set, this prefix will be used in lieu of the actual category prefix.

If you would like to rename your DBSEO CP folder, you can do so with this link.

Note: You will still need to physically rename the folder via FTP!
This setting lets you define a custom domain for Blog URLs.
This setting lets you define a custom domain for CMS URLs.
This setting lets you define a custom domain for Forum URLs.

You can use this setting to add custom 301 redirects as regular expressions without needing to modify your .htaccess file.
Use // in front of a rule definition to disable it.

See the default data for some example redirect rules.

You can define custom rewrite rules as regular expressions below.
Use // in front of a rule definition to disable it.

See the default data for some example rewrite rules.
If you disable this, the version number you are running will not be shown to the public.
If yes, this adds a link to the DragonByte SEO AdminCP in the footer, on the same line that the current vB AdminCP / ModCP links reside.
If yes, this will add a log entry every time a spider accesses your sitemap files.

This is a global on/off switch for the social sharing features of DragonByte SEO. If this setting is turned off, no social sharing buttons are displayed regardless of other settings.

The social sharing buttons are powered by AddThis.com. Turning them on may mean your users receive advertising cookies.
[Privacy Policy] | [Terms of Service] | [Per-User Opt Out]
If yes, this will add a log entry every time a spider accesses your forum pages.
This setting controls whether tags are automatically added to content like threads when it's posted.
This setting controls whether Thread content is automatically tagged.
If you'd like to exclude certain forums from the automatic content tagging system, you can select them here.
If yes, only the thread titles will be used to auto-generate tags. Will only work if the system and the thread tagging system is enabled.

This setting enables UTF-8 support for various parts of DragonByte SEO.

Only enable this setting if your forum uses UTF-8 as its character set.

You can add a list of files that should not be affected by URL rewrite rules here.
Use either regular expression syntax, or spell out the full file name.
One instruction per line.

Examples:
^attachment(\w)+\.php
ckeditor.php

This will prevent tracking systems on external sites to be able to pinpoint where exactly from your forum this link originated. Useful if you run a closed community with lots of private forums.

Note: Do not enable this setting if you are using Viglinks or Skimlinks for affiliate tracking.

Domains in the blacklist will always have rel="nofollow" added to their URLs even if they are in excluded forums.

One domain per line (http://www is not required)
rel="nofollow" tells search engines not to leave your site to crawl the sites linked in your threads / posts. This setting lets you append it automatically to external URLs.
You can choose certain forums to be excluded from having their external links changed with this setting.

Domains in the whitelist will not have rel="nofollow" added to their URLs.

One domain per line (http://www is not required)
If yes, special characters will be filtered from Tags.

This setting lets you filter custom characters from the SEO URLs.

Examples:
Č => c
ş => s


Characters that has a value below 256 should use the following format (actual character):
Ü => u
ö => o

Enter 1 character replacement set per line
This setting will replace non-Latin characters with their Latin equivalents (i.e. Café would become Cafe).
If yes, this setting will crop out /forum.php (or whatever other script name you've defined as forum root in vBulletin Options). This is useful if you've already built page rank for /index.php.

You can choose the HTTP response code for generic vBulletin error pages here.
Recommended: 404

If you have legacy "Forum" URL formats that are not compatible with DBSEO, you can enable this setting to force DBSEO to generate legacy Forum URLs.

Warning: This setting should not be enabled unless you are certain you need it! This setting is unsupported.

This setting controls how links posted are handled. The title of the link posted can either be kept as-is, added to mouse-over via the title attribute, appended to the original link text or overwritten entirely.

If you want to ensure your site never retrieves titles from certain domains, you can configure them here.

Separate each domain by a | symbol.
Regular expression modifiers available.
Whether the above setting also applies to External URLs.

If your users are having difficulties posting messages with multiple external links, lower this setting.
0 = no limit (strongly not recommended)
If enabled, you will be able to customise each individual thread's Meta Keyword and Meta Description tags.
Enable Custom Thread Meta Keywords / Description
Enabling this will enable changing the "Description" Meta tag for blogs.
Enabling this will enable changing the "Description" Meta tag for forums.
This is the number of characters used for the "Description" Meta tag. Usually 150-200 characters or less.

Enter a custom string to be used for the "Description" Meta tag for member profiles.

The following replacement variables are available:
[username] - The user name of the person whose profile is being viewed
[usertitle] - The user title (such as Moderator) of the person whose profile is being viewed
[bb_title] - The site name as defined in vBulletin's "Site Name" option.
[user_field_1] / [user_field_2] - User profile fields as defined in the "User Profile Fields" section in the AdminCP. Replace the number with the number from the "field ID".
Enabling this will enable changing the "Description" Meta tag for member profiles.
Enabling this will enable changing the "Description" Meta tag for posts.

Enter a custom string to be used for the "Description" Meta tag for the tag cloud.

The following replacement variables are available:
[bb_title] - The site name as defined in vBulletin's "Site Name" option.
Enabling this will enable changing the "Description" Meta tag for tags.

Enter a custom string to be used for the "Description" Meta tag for the tag list.

The following replacement variables are available:
[tag] - The tag the user is searching for.
[page] - Current page number. [bb_title] - The site name as defined in vBulletin's "Site Name" option.
Enabling this will enable changing the "Description" Meta tag for threads.
Enabling this will enable changing the "Keywords" Meta tag for blogs.
Enabling this will enable changing the "Keywords" Meta tag for forums.
This is the number of keywords used for the "Keywords" Meta tag. Usually 5-10 keywords or less.
Enabling this will enable changing the "Keywords" Meta tag for member profiles.
Enabling this will enable changing the "Keywords" Meta tag for posts.
Enabling this will enable changing the "Keywords" Meta tag for threads.
If you need to use a custom prefix for your "Nav Bullet" image paths, you can change it here.

You can choose the HTTP response code for "No Permissions" vBulletin error pages here.
Recommended: 403

You can choose how you want "404 File Not Found" requests to be handled with this setting.

Redirect to Home Page will provide a header redirect to your chosen front page (index.php).
Send HTTP 404 will let your web server handle the error.
Run Custom Script will include a custom PHP file that you can define in the setting below.

If you choose to include a custom PHP file, you can input its path here.
Example: /home/domain/404.php
If set, this password can be used either to grant access to people who do not have usergroup permissions to access the DragonByte SEO Control Panel, or as an additional security measure.
You can choose what kind of password mode you'd like to use. Has no effect if the above option is blank.

If yes, this will enable a log of all SEO'd URLs and their respective vBulletin URLs. This saves having to check multiple URL formats to find a match, but queries the database instead.

Note: May not be suitable for very large forums, as the database table can grow very large.
You can optionally enter your DBTech affiliate ID here. This is your user ID over at the DragonByte Tech Forums. You can read more about the affiliation system here.

"Stopwords" are words that have little value to search engines when it comes to indexing your content. This setting lets you filter them out to improve the value of your URLs.
Only on long URLs only filters the stopwords if the URL is longer than the specified limit.
You can choose to exclude Meta Description from stopword filtering, or use a separate stopword list, with this setting.
This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Member Album URLs.
This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Announcement URLs.
This setting lets you toggle whether you want the "Attachment Alt Attribute" rewritten.
This setting lets you toggle whether you want the Attachment URL rewritten.

This setting lets you toggle whether you want the "Custom Avatar" URL rewritten.

Note:

This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Blog URLs.
Note: All these options work for the vBulletin Blog (by vBulletin) only!

This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Blog Attachment URLs.
Note: All these options work for the vBulletin Blog (by vBulletin) only!

This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Blog Category URLs.
Note: All these options work for the vBulletin Blog (by vBulletin) only!

This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Blog Custom Page URLs.
Note: All these options work for the vBulletin Blog (by vBulletin) only!

This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Blog Entry URLs.
Note: All these options work for the vBulletin Blog (by vBulletin) only!
If yes, blog entry SEO titles will be generated based on defined keywords as opposed to filtered blog entry titles.

This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Blog Feed URLs.
Note: All these options work for the vBulletin Blog (by vBulletin) only!

This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Blog List URLs.
Note: All these options work for the vBulletin Blog (by vBulletin) only!

This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Blog Tag URLs.
Note: All these options work for the vBulletin Blog (by vBulletin) only!

This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for CMS URLs.
Note: All these options work for the vBulletin 4.x CMS (by vBulletin) only!
If yes, entry SEO titles will be generated based on defined keywords as opposed to filtered entry titles.
This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for emails sent via vBulletin's mail function.
This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Forum URLs.

You can choose certain forums whose threads should be flagged "nofollow" with this setting.

Choose all the forums whose thread content cannot be viewed by guests.
This setting lets you toggle whether you want the "Member List" URL rewritten.
This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Member Profile URLs.
This setting lets you toggle whether you want the "Nav Bullet" URL rewritten.
This is the text that will be used in SEO URLs in lieu of a prefix ID if no prefix has been found.
This setting lets you toggle whether you want the "Poll" URL rewritten.
This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Printer-Friendly Thread URLs.
If yes, this will add rel="nofollow" to the "Printer-Friendly Thread" URLs, potentially avoiding an issue with duplicate content.

You must use [album_id] or [album_title] and [user_id] or [user_name].

Available variables:
[album_id]
[album_title]
[user_id]
[user_name]
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Album URLs.

You must use [page] and either [user_id] or [user_name].

Available variables:
[album_id]
[album_title]
[user_id]
[user_name]
[page]
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Album (Paged) URLs.
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Album List URLs.

You must use [page] and either [user_id] or [user_name].

Available variables:
[user_id]
[user_name]
[page]
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Album List (Paged) URLs.

You must use [album_id] or [album_title], [picture_id] or [picture_title] and [user_id] or [user_name].

Available variables:
[album_id]
[album_title]
[picture_id]
[picture_title]
[user_id]
[user_name]
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Album Picture URLs.

You must use [page] and either [user_id] or [user_name].

Available variables:
[album_id]
[album_title]
[picture_id]
[picture_title]
[user_id]
[user_name]
[page]
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Album Picture (Paged) URLs.

You must use [original_ext] as well as [album_id] or [album_title], [picture_id] or [picture_title] and [user_id] or [user_name].

Available variables:
[original_ext]
[album_id]
[album_title]
[picture_id]
[picture_title]
[user_id]
[user_name]
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Album Picture File URLs.
There are no variables available for this setting.
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for "All Blog Entries" List URLs.
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for "All Blog Entries" List (Paged) URLs.

You can use [forum_path] to create a virtual multi-level forum path (vB5-like).

Ideally, you should include the [announcement_id] variable, as this will eliminate conflicts and improve performance.

You must use [forum_path], [forum_id] or [forum_title], as well as [announcement_id] or [announcement_title].

Available variables:
[forum_id]
[forum_title]
[forum_path]
[announcement_id]
[announcement_title]
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Announcement URLs.

You can use [forum_path] to create a virtual multi-level forum path (vB5-like).

You must use [forum_path], [forum_id] or [forum_title].

Available variables:
[forum_id]
[forum_title]
[forum_path]
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for the "View All Announcements" URL.
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for the Attachment Alt Attribute.

You can use [forum_path] to create a virtual multi-level forum path (vB5-like).

You must use [attachment_id].

Available variables:
[forum_id]
[forum_title]
[forum_path]
[thread_id]
[thread_title]
[prefix_id]
[attachment_id]
[original_filename]
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for the Attachment URLs.

Ideally, you should include the [user_id] variable, as this will eliminate conflicts and improve performance.

Available variables:
[user_id]
[user_name]
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Avatar URLs.
There are no variables available for this setting.
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for "Best Blog Entries" List URLs.
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for "Best Blog Entries" List (Paged) URLs.
There are no variables available for this setting.
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for "Best Blogs" List URLs.
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for "Best Blogs" List (Paged) URLs.
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Blog URLs.

You must use [page] and either [user_id] or [user_name].

Available variables:
[user_id]
[user_name]
[page]
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Blog (Paged) URLs.
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Blog Attachment URLs.
This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for Blog Category URLs.

This setting lets you control the rewrite rule for "Blogs By Day" List (Global, Paged) URLs.

This will let you control which character should separate the various parts of an URL fragment.
Using the default value of - is recommended.
This setting lets you toggle whether you want the "view single post" URL rewritten.
This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Social Group URLs.
This setting lets you toggle whether you want the "Tag" URLs rewritten.
This setting lets you toggle the URL rewrite engine for Thread URLs.
If you'd like to include the thread prefixes (if any) in your rewrite rules, enable this setting
If you'd like to include the thread prefix names (if any) in your rewrite rules, enable this setting

If yes, thread SEO titles will be generated based on defined keywords as opposed to filtered thread titles.

Note: This can have an effect on performance.

You can use this setting to control the maximum number of keywords that will be used when generating your URLs.

Recommended value is either 0 (default) or a value between 5 and 7.

If you are using a custom URL for your search engine (such as Google Custom Search), you can alter this variable to match your search form.

Available replacement variables:
{bburl} (your forum URL)
{homeurl} (your home page URL)
{search_term_string} (Required).
This setting lets you specify a path to a file containing URLs that will be imported into the "Custom Sitemap URLs" table automatically on each sitemap generation.

If you select yes for this option, the XML sitemap will be automatically generated periodically by a scheduled task.

Even if you select no, you can still manually generate the sitemap.
If automatic sitemap generation is enabled, this option controls the number of days between automatic builds.
If you enter an email address here, it will receive a notification every time the sitemap files have been generated, containing a summary report.

Enter the forum ID(s) for the forums you don't want to be included in the sitemap files. Forums inaccessible to guests are always excluded.
Separate multiple forum IDs with spaces, like so: 1 2 3

The default value is recommended in order to avoid unnecessary re-crawling.

XML sitemap data must be written to the filesystem to function. Enter the full path to the directory the files should be written to. Do not include a trailing slash.

This directory must be writable by the webserver.
This setting lets you define a priority value between 0.0 and 1.0 to instruct the crawler how important this content is relevant to other pages.

Choose the hour of day the sitemap generation should run
Select the search engines that you wish to notify when a new sitemap has been generated (manually or via a scheduled task).

Enter the number of URLs that will be processed per page (and placed in each sitemap file). Note that only one type of content will be written to a file, so it is possible that there will be files that have less URLs than the number specified here.

Enter a value no larger than 50,000. Larger values may cause more performance impact while the sitemap is being generated.

DragonByte SEO tracks how many times search engines hit your sitemap files each day. This setting lets you control the number of days these logs are retained.

Higher values mean more database storage space is required, and may impact performance of log browsing.
This setting controls whether Social Sharing buttons appear inside the comment content on the Blog Entry page.
This setting controls whether Social Sharing buttons appear above the post list on the Blog Entry page.
This setting controls whether Social Sharing buttons appear below the post list on the Blog Entry page.
This setting controls whether the "Share to Facebook" button is available.
This setting controls whether the "Share to Google+" button is available.
This setting controls whether the "Share to LinkedIn" button is available.

This setting controls whether the "Share to Pinterest" button is available.

Note: Not available in the Vertical (With Button Count) display style.

This setting controls whether the "Share to Reddit" button is available.

Note: Not available in the Horizontal (With Button Count) or Vertical (With Button Count) display styles.
This setting controls whether the "Share to Twitter" button is available.
If you'd like to exclude certain forums from the social sharing system, you can select them here.
If you have an account at AddThis.com (registration is free) you can enter your publisher ID here to track your AddThis shares.
This setting controls whether Social Sharing buttons appear inside the message content on the Social Group Discussion page.
This setting controls whether Social Sharing buttons appear above the post list on the Social Group Discussion page.
Social Group Discussion: Above Post List
This setting controls whether Social Sharing buttons appear below the post list on the Social Group Discussion page.
Social Group Discussion: Below Post List
This setting controls whether Social Sharing buttons appear after the first post on the Show Thread page.
This setting controls whether Social Sharing buttons appear after the first post on the Show Thread page.
This setting controls whether Social Sharing buttons appear inside the post content on the Show Thread page.
This setting controls whether Social Sharing buttons appear above the post list on the Show Thread page.
This setting controls whether Social Sharing buttons appear below the post list on the Show Thread page.

If you select any of the usergroups here, only members of this/these usergroup(s) will be allowed to use social sharing buttons.
Select only the blank option to allow all usergroups to use social sharing buttons.

DragonByte SEO tracks how many times search engines crawl your pages each day, and what pages they crawl. This setting lets you control the number of days these logs are retained.

Higher values mean more database storage space is required, and may impact performance of log browsing.

This is the list of words that should be filtered from generated URLs.
Place one word per line.

A list of stopwords can be found here: http://www.lextek.com/manuals/onix/stopwords1.html

[Default Stopwords]

This is the list of words that should be filtered from Meta Descriptions.
Place one word per line.
When the above "Keyword Only" option is turned off, this setting controls whether numbers are included as possible content tags.
If yes, only keywords found in your "Manage Keywords" interface and the "Thread Tag Allowed Words" setting will be applied.

If your forum does not use UTF-8 in its database, you can enable this setting to convert URLs to UTF-8.

This only works if your Character Set is set to UTF-8.

Choose whether you want the www. subdomain added to your URLs or not.
Any visits not using the correct subdomain will be redirected with a 301 redirect to the subdomain style you choose.
